column4: I install ubuntu and never been able to install windows again. why?
did you leave unpartitioned space on your hd for windows?
is a new notebook using sata hard disk, it keep saying that no hard disk found
you probably need to download the drivers for the sata controller
and then push f6 during windows setup boot to load the drivers from floppy...
how to remove linux file system?
boot up using a live cd and delete all partitions using gparted
live cd have gparted?
your mean gparted live cd or ubuntu live cd
either one
but you can delete them once you get windows to recognize your hd
had try using gparted live cd to delete away everything but windows still cannot find hd
then windows is more-than-likely not detecting your SATA Controller
think the note book is mean for media centre and not normal XP
media center is just normal xp with addons and additional drivers
what model laptop is it?
but it can detect usb external hard disk. model HP compaq V3000 series
thats because your windows has usb drivers built into the cd
what is the specific model?
HP COMPAQ V3345TU
I would hop over the the ##windows channel and post your question there
think you are right. Because the notebook ship original with Vista, and I am trying to install WInXP on it
my XP CD might not have sata controler support
true...
